alert.note: Alert for Uinta (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 6:27AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and upstream dam releases will increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding along the Bear River from below Woodruff Narrows Reservoir northward to the Utah/Wyoming line west of Sage Junction, Wyoming caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases. * WHERE...Portions of northern Utah and southwest Wyoming, including the following counties, in northern Utah, Rich. In southwest Wyoming, Uinta. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along the Bear River will continue to impact mainly agricultural areas and low-lying roadways near the Bear River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 AM MDT, Gauge and trained spotter reports indicate flooding is ongoing due to snowmelt and reservoir releases. The Bear River is expected to remain high in this area until further notice. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Randolph and Woodruff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
